Authors: Xiao-Xia Ding, Yang-Yang Cui, Zhu-Liang Yang
Title:
Two new species of Tricholoma sect. Genuina (Agaricales) from
China based on molecular phylogenetic and morphological evidence
Keywords:
Phylogenetic analyses, Taxonomy, ITS inference, Novel
species
Abstract:
As a large section within ectomycorrhizal genus
Tricholoma, fungi of sect. Genuina play important roles in forest
ecosystem. However, subtle morphological characters make it difficult to
clarify the species diversity of this section. In this study, two new
species of T. sect. Genuina collected from southwestern China are
described with both molecular phylogenetic and morphological evidence.
Tricholoma fulvomaculatum is characterized by its viscid, red-brown
pileus, rusty spots on the surface of the yellow lamellae, white base of
the stipe and ellipsoid basidiospores, while T. rufobrunneum is featured
by its dry, red-brown, squamous pileus and stipe, and its distribution
in subalpine coniferous forests between 3600 and 3700 m altitude.
Besides, known distribution ranges of T. sinoacerbum, originally
described from southern China, are largely extended.
